thread.title: Report: Seahawks to sign CB Crezdon Butler
thread.title_full: Report: Seahawks to sign CB Crezdon Butler - seattlepi.com

author: STEPHEN COHEN, SEATTLEPI.COM
title: Report: Seahawks to sign CB Crezdon Butler
text:
The Seattle Seahawks will add some much needed depth to their secondary by signing veteran cornerback Crezdon Butler on Tuesday, according to a report from NFL Media's Rand Getlin.
Citing a source on Monday, Getlin tweeted that Seattle will add the five-year veteran, who played in 11 games with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers in 2014, starting three before being waived in December.
The 6-foot, 183-pounder will compete for playing time in the Hawks secondary after Seattle placed Tharold Simon on injured reserve on Saturday and with Marcus Burley sidelined with a broken thumb.
Seattle will be Butler's seventh NFL team, with previous stints with the Pittsburgh Steelers, Arizona Cardinals, Washington, Buffalo Bills, San Diego Chargers, Buccaneers and Detroit Lions. He has 19 combined tackles, two forced fumbles and a pass defensed in 36 career games.
Butler was the Steelers' second of three fifth-round draft picks in 2010 after a college career at Clemson, where he played alongside former Seahawks cornerback Byron Maxwell.
